ovdesc.p: This property class represents the DEPOSIT product for the module AZ in T24. This property class is used for classic products.

desc.p: Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.

This field indicates if the rolled over new maturity date should be a working day or not.

If the field is Yes, during rollover of loans & deposits, if the new maturity date happens to be on a holiday, then the system shall set the new maturity date to the first working day after the rolled over date.
Assume that value date of AZ is 10th Aug 2005 & maturity date is 15th Aug 2005 . Then during rollover, the system shall set Value date as 15th Aug & new maturity date as 20th Aug.
If the field is YES & 20th Aug happens to be a holiday & first working day after rollover is 22nd Aug , then new maturity date will be set to 22nd Aug.
If the field is NO, then new maturity date will still be 20th Aug only.
Allowed values - YES,NO.
NO & null are treated the same.
Defines the notice period in days for the corresponding reschedule type, for all the AZ accounts opened under this product.
For a particular type of reschedule, the reschedule notice will be linked and the reschedule event will happen after the expiry of reschedule notice.
The valid types of reschedules are:
1. Rate Change 2. Lump sum Repayment 3. Redraw 4. Term Change 5. Frequency Change

Note: At present, only Rate Change is supported. If the BASIC.INTEREST is changed today or for a forward date after the contract is input then this change is applied to the az.account after the number of days defined in this field. The BI change is processed during COB.
Multi value field associated with Reschedule Type
Input allowed only if reschedule Type is defined
1-99 numeric character with period D, M or Y (Example: 15D, 01M)
Not applicable for credit card loans

Defines the margin rate of interest that has to be deducted from the eligible rate arrived for early redemption of deposit amount.

For example if margin is defined as 2, and for early redemption of a deposit the eligible interest was arrived as 9% after referring the interest table, then the final interest paid for this early redemption will be 7%
Numeric Value.

Defines the charges to be levied for pre-closure of the deposit / loan account or part withdrawal of deposit.

These charges will be debited only if the pre-closure of the deposit / loan is done by using AZ.ACCOUNT. The withdrawals made through other channels like Teller or ATM, the system will not recognise the differential interest and the charges. In these cases, the pre-closure fee and differential fee are to be debited manually.
Should be a valid charge code defined under FT.CHARGE.TYPE or FT.COMMISSION.TYPE.
Defines whether a portion of the funds available in the fixed Deposit can be allowed for redemption, before the maturity date of the deposit.

If 'Y' is defined the accounts opened under this deposit product will have the facility of part redemption. If 'N' is defined, part redemption facility will not be available for deposit accounts opened under this product

When a rule is broken what action needs to be taken is defined here. Currently, the various options available are
Error block further processing
Override Give an override

FLOOR the rule value is to be used as a FLOOR if the rule is broken
Should be one of the above valid options
This field specifies if accounting entries over the AZ.ACCOUNT need to be raised during rollover. This could be useful for passbook printing purposes.
For example,
Let us assume that the deposit is for 5000.
If the MATURITY.INSTR is 'AUTOMATIC ROLLOVER' then during rollover the following entries will be generated.
A. Nominated account is given,
Case 1. Rollover amount - 5000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Nominated a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Dr Nominated a/c 5000
Case 2. Rollover amount - 6000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Nominated a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 6000
Dr Nominated a/c 6000
Case 3. Rollover amount - 4000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Nominated a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 4000
Dr Nominated a/c 4000
B. No nominated account given,
Case 1. Rollover amount - 5000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Internal a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Dr Internal a/c 5000
Case 2. Rollover amount - 6000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Internal a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 6000
Dr Internal a/c 6000
Create a TELLER.DEFAULT crediting AZ.ACCOUNT for 1000.
Case 3. Rollover amount - 4000
Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000
Cr Internal a/c 5000
Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 4000
Dr Internal a/c 4000
Create a TELLER.DEFAULT debiting Internal account for 1000.
MATURITY.DR txn code will be used on the debit side and ROLLOVER.CR txn code will be used on the credit side entries to AZ.ACCOUNT.
If nominated account is not provided then an internal account will be used. The category of the internal account need to be defined in ACCOUNT.CLASS application for 'AZROLLOVER' id.
Allowed only if ACCT.SYNC is set to 'Y'.
Allowed only for FIXED type deposits.

To find this eligible interest rate, the system has to refer either the current periodic interest table or the periodic interest table that corresponds to the opening date of the deposit or the lowest of these two rates or trigger a routine to get the interest rate.

This field indicates whether to create TELLER.DEFAULT or not for the interest amount during part withdrawal(through TELLER) /Pre closure when till account is used as credit side account.

If this value is YES then a TELLER.DEFAULT record will be created when a TELLER transaction is processed debiting an AZ.ACCOUNT Fixed Deposit. This will only be created when no nominated/interest liquidation is specified on the AZ.ACCOUNT.
If the field CREATE.TD.FOR.INT is NULL the interest will be credited to the credit side account irrespective of it being the till account.
Validation rules:
Value of YES is permitted only for Deposits & with Teller product installed in the company
Defines the Repayment type of the All in One Accounts opened under this product. This type determines the way in which the loan / deposit account is to be repaid.
The repayment types available for loan accounts are:
1. ANNUITY

This type of loan has a fixed periodic repayment amount (the 'annuity') consisting of two variable components of principal and interest. The repayment amount is calculated at the start of the contract so that the principal will be fully repaid after the required number of repayments. Initially, repayments consist mostly of interest. However, as the contract progresses, the size of the principal component increases as the accrued interest reduces.
In All in One loan account, for defining a zero repayment at the start of the loan, for a fixed period, Annuity type of repayment can be defined in the schedule with amount as Zero.
2. LINEAR

Linear loans also have an interest and a principal component to their periodic repayments. In this case, however, the principal repayment amount remains fixed over the lifetime of the contract. The interest element reduces as the accrued interest on the reducing balance decreases. This leads to a repayment scheme whereby the total periodic repayment reduces over the lifetime of the contract.
3. NONRED
In NONRED type of loans, there is no regular repayment of principal, but only interest. The redemption of Principal will be done on maturity date of the loan.
In All in One account loans, the validations relating to Interest Only and Maximum Period interest only will not happen for this type of loan.
4. OTHER
Non structured repayments are handled under this type. Repayment of any amount on any dates are allowed, provided the total repayment amount is equal to principal.
5.CREDIT CARD

This type of Loan repayment type was added from G14.0.00. For this repayment type, the schedules are NO. When the repayment type is Credit Card the regular schedules are discarded, sub a/cs are created and new types of schedules like CI, CC are generated automatically.
Repayment types available for Deposit accounts are:
FIXED
Deposit amount is accepted in a fixed lump sum and repaid as fixed amount either with interest accumulated or not.
SAVING PLAN
Deposit amount is accepted in a periodic basis and the principal is increased in a recurring manner till the end of a fixed term.
1 to 12 Alpha characters.
Input must be either 'ANNUITY', 'LINEAR', 'OTHERS', 'NONRED' or 'CREDIT CARD' for loan products and 'SAVINGS PLAN' or 'FIXED' for Deposit products.

This field is used to decide whether accrued interest has to be paid out or rolled over during rollover of a fixed deposit. Allowed values are YES or NO

If 'YES' is defined, then during rollover, the accrued interest before rollover will be paid out .When final maturity is reached or maturity instruction is Payment to Nominated account, then interest will be paid to Nominated account.

If 'NO' is defined, then interest will be rolled over along with the principal deposit amount by default. The amount of rolled over deposit can anyway be overridden by the rollover amount definition at AZ.ACCOUNT level

Defines the maturity instruction for the deposit accounts opened under this product.
If 'Automatic Rollover' is specified the deposit will be rolled over with the same terms as that of the original deposit.
If 'Payment to Nominated Account' is defined here, on date of maturity the maturity amount will be credited to the nominated account specified in the deposit account.
Partial Rollovers and rollover with additional amount are handled at account level.
Permitted values : 'Automatic Rollover' / 'Payment to Nominated Account'
Allowed only for FIXED type deposits
This field specifies the id of TELLER.PASSBOOK that need to be used while printing passbooks for this product.
This field provides a facility to define different passbook layouts for different products.
The id must be a valid id in TELLER.PASSBOOK.
If not defined then the id SYSTEM in TELLER.PASSBOOK will be used by default while printing passbooks.

A local routine with a valid PGM.FILE entry with PGM.TYPE set to 'S' can be attached in this field. This routine will be triggered when a part withdrawal or preclose of a deposit happens. If it is a multi deposit then this routine will be triggered for every sub account during preclosure / part withdrawal.
This field is allowed only if PI.TABLE.TO.USE is set to OTHERS.
The routine to be triggered will have to be input as 'LOCAL.ROUTINE(INTEREST.RATE)'.
Where INTEREST.RATE is the rate that is returned from the routine. This rate will be used instead of EARLY.RED.MARGIN if any given.

This field specifies the value that should be set in the SINGLE.LIMIT field in the ACCOUNT that is attached to this APP.
Input can be 'Y', 'N' or ''.
If input as 'Y' then the acct that is attached to the product parameter should also have the field single limit marked as yes.

If input as 'N' or '' then the acct that is attached to the product parameter cannot have the field single limit marked as 'Y'. In this case all the AZ.ACCOUNT that are linked to the same limit must have REDUCE.LIMIT set to be the same.
VALIDATIONS
Input can be either 'Y', 'N' or ''.

When the arrangement level record is next used all items in the NEGOTIATED.FIELDS list will be maintained.

Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.

No input and multi value field - lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
Defines the frequency of further credits to the deposit account.
In the case of deposits like Savings Plan, Recurring Deposit, this field is use for defining the frequency of future credits expected.
For example, if M01 is defined here, regular monthly credits to the account are expected.
Type of input allowed are: D<nn>,W<nn>, M<nn>.

This field and grace period field should have a rationale input i.e. Grace can't be Month. End while the deposit frequency is daily. This validation is valid from 14.2.00 with the introduction of period. end option in Grace period field.
Defines the frequency for interest credit, for all deposit accounts opened under this product.
Example

If 'M01' is defined here, this frequency will be defaulted to the deposit account of this product and interest will be credited / capitalised every month from the start date. This is acheived by defaulting the 'I' schedule into the az.account during creation.
If a liquidation account is defined in ACCOUNT then interest will be credited to that account as per this frequency. Otherwise the interest will be capitalised in the Deposit account itself

If 'NM01' is defined here, then the interest will be paid out to the nominated account after capitalising it every month from the start date. This is acheived by defaulting the 'IN' schedule into the az.account during creation.

This field is also used during deposit rollover. Based on the setup done here either a 'I' or 'IN' schedule will be created during rollover. If this is not defined then the 'IN' schedule will be created on maturity after rollover.
Type of input allowed are: Dnn,Wnn, Mnn
Defines the type by which the credit interest frequency will be processed for the deposit accounts opened under this product.
This field is associated with CR.INT.FQU ( frequency for interest credit)
Allowed types are: ANNIVERSARY / PERIOD.END
If ANNIVERSARY is defined then the credit interest frequency will be based on the opening date.
If PERIOD.END is defined then the credit interest will be based on the calendar end like month end.
